intro: Gomphostemma macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaf gomphostemma, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 12 inches in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its stems are woody and often have a reddish hue, especially during the growing season. Gomphostemma macrophyllum is typically found in moist, rich soils along stream banks and in woodland areas.
